IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE-V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
Present:- Smt. Aswathy.S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Monday the 27" day of January, 2025./ 7" Magha, 1946
CC. 664/2018
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Thumba Police
Station in Crime No. 05/2018.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused - Vamsi Krishna, 25/2018 years, S/o. Surendran, Kottakkari
Veedu, Kariyil, Vilayilkulam Ward, Menamkulam Village.
(By Advocate Sri. Kishorkumar. T.R)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 323, 427 and 354 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused is found not guilty of offences punishable under
sections 323, 427 and 354 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and he is
acquitted of the said offences under section 248(1) Code of
Criminal Procedure, 1973. His bail bond stand cancelled and he
is set at liberty.

2 of 6
evidence delay
This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 323, 427 and 354
of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- Due to the enmity on
31.12.2017, at 05.00 pm, near the Vilayilkulam — Kazhakkoottam public road,
the accused pushed down CW2, when CW1 intervened and tried to lift CW2,
the accused by uttering obscene words hit on the back of CW1, thereby she
dishonoured . It is alleged that the accused beaten all over the body parts of
CW3 and caused damage to the gate and thereby CW1 sustained loss of
Rs.2000/-. Thus accused committed offences punishable under sections 323,
427 and 354 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed before this court by the Sub Inspector of police Thumba
police station and the case was taken on file as CC.664/2018. Cognizance was
taken for the offences punishable under sections 323, 427 and 354 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 against the accused.

4. On appearance of the accused, he was enlarged on bail on 04.01.2018. Copies
of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to him under section 207

3 of 6

Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing prosecution and counsel for

accused charge framed for offences under sections 323, 427 and 354 of Indian

Penal Code, 1860 read over and explained to the accused to which he pleaded

not guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 and PW2 were examined and Ext. P1 was
marked. As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the
learned Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW4 to CW10. CW2 reported
no more. Death certificate produced. In the absence of any incriminating
circumstances against the accused questioning of the accused under section
313(1)(b) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 was dispensed with. Accused
was called upon to adduce evidence but no defence evidence was adduced
from the side of the accused.

6. Heard both sides and perued records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 31.12.2017, at 5.00 pm, at Vilayilkulam - Kazhakkoottam road,
Pallithura Ward, Attipra Village, accused pushed CW2 to the ground, and
hit on the back of CW1 when she intervened and fisted CW3 on his various
body parts and thereby committed the offence punishable u/s. 323 of the
Indian Penal Code 1860?

(2) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused committed
mischief by damaging the gate of CW1 with a chopper and caused a loss

4 of 6
worth Rs. 2000/- to CW1 and thereby committed the offence punishable
u/s. 427 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(3) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused beaten CW1 on
her back by uttering obscene words and thereby outraged the modesty of
CW1 and thereby accused committed an offence punishable w/s. 354 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(4) If the accused is found guilty? What is the order as to sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 to 3_:-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point numbers 1 to 3
are considered together. Prosecution case is that accused has committed
offences punishable under sections 323, 427 and 354 of Indian Penal Code,
1860.

9. PW1, deposed that she had given complaint to the police regarding the alleged
incident of this case. She admitted her signature in the Ext P1 statement .
According to her she does not know the accused in this case and she has no
grievance against the accused, and the accused has not assaulted her. She
further deposed that she is not intending to proceed with the case.

10. PW2, Sajeer deposed that PW1 is his sister. He denied the statement before the
police and deposed that he had not witnessed the incident that the accused
assaulting PW1.

5 of 6

11. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and he is
justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused. For the said reason
these points are found against the prosecution.

12. Point No.4 :- Upon the finding in point nos. 1 to 3, the accused is found not
guilty of offences punishable under sections 323, 427 and 354 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860 and he is acquitted for the said offences under section 248(1) Code
of Criminal Procedure, 1973. His bail bond stand cancelled and he is set at
liberty.

The machette was produced before this court as T No.2/18 will be destroyed
after the appeal period is over according to law .
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 27" day of January, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial J Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
